intro: Cyphostemma adamii, commonly known as the Adam's cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in shrubland. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
